html: Worldwide calamity ensues after “the windows on high are opened,” signifying a Sodom-and-Gomorrah type of destruction. Cosmic cataclysm—when “the earth shall shake to its foundation”—signals the start of an onslaught of covenant curses that befall the wicked and from which there appears no escape ( Isaiah 13:13-15). Isaiah uses assonance and alliteration to depict the “terrors” (pahad), “pitfalls” (pahat), and “traps” (pah) that spread pervasively throughout the earth, reflecting a point of no return for its inhabitants until the entire cycle of deliverance and destruction has fulfilled its purpose.
